hits.book_ref: Life-study of Leviticus, msg. 40: Uncleanness Issuing from Within Man  (2)
hits.snippet: A leper was also to cover his upper lip. He “was to have the lower part of his face bound around with a bandage, leaving the mouth just freedom enough to make the declaration, Unclean, unclean!” (George Bush). Covering the upper lip indicates that whatever issues out of a leper (a sinner) is filthy and contagious and that he should not be contacted. [355]
